snippet: As the diplomacy gathered pace, Russia again renewed its opposition to an Arab League plan that calls for President Bashar al-Assad of Syria to cede power.

byline.original: By NEIL MacFARQUHAR and NADA BAKRI
byline.contributor: Neil MacFarquhar reported from the United Nations, and Nada Bakri from Beirut, Lebanon. Reporting was contributed by Alan Cowell from London, Hwaida Saadi and an employee of The New York Times from Beirut, Michael Schwirtz from Moscow, and Steven Lee Myers from Washington.

lead_paragraph: As the diplomacy gathered pace, Russia again renewed its opposition to an Arab League plan that calls for President Bashar al-Assad of Syria to cede power.

headline.seo: Diplomats Prepare to Press Bashar al-Assad to Leave Office
headline.main: Diplomats Jockey Over Assad’s Future as Syrian Troops Press Attacks Near Capital
headline.print_headline: Diplomats Jockey Over Assad’s Future as Syria Fighting Escalates

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
